title: incorrect smartsize
author: 7OH
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
smart size must represent current monitor\desktop size.
in earlier version it were work fine.

## Current Behavior
Current desktop(second monitor) resolution is 1920x1080
In rdp session it 2386x1473.
as result all element are very small.
in rdp usually resolution cannot be changed.

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
1. get 2 monitors system. 1st monitor 1920x1080 150%, second (work) monitor 1920x1080 100%.
2. Run mRemoteNG on second monitor.
3. connect to rdp wit...

iterations.description: SmartSize uses wrong DPI scaling on multi-monitor setups with mixed DPI — ResolutionScalingFactor reads main form DPI instead of the actual monitor's DPI where the RDP control is hosted.

notes:
AI triage (claude): SmartSize uses wrong DPI scaling on multi-monitor setups with mixed DPI — ResolutionScalingFactor reads main form DPI instead of the actual monitor's DPI where the RDP control is hosted.
Approach: Change ResolutionScalingFactor to use the DPI of the monitor where the InterfaceControl (or its parent ConnectionWindow) is actually displayed, rather than _frmMain.DeviceDpi. Use Screen.FromControl(InterfaceControl) or the control's own DeviceDpi property to get per-monitor DPI.
